{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3559918,"name":"","username":"veruca_salt2.0","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/f17d59/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-17T23:42:46.780Z","cooked":"

Hello! I am a relatively new programmer and completely self-taught. I’m attempting to use PathPlanner for our auto, and have a lot of questions. Also I know no one likes mec, we tried using swerve but it wasn’t ready in time for our week 3 comp so we just moved back to what we are used to. We will transition to it next season. I’m using Java.

  1. What are the advantages of using a RaspberryPi on the robot? Do I have to use the newest version or can a Pi 3 or 4 do?
  2. How do I configure a mecanum robot in the PathPlanner robot config? Would it be the same as swerve since they’re both holonomic drive?
  3. At our last comp we had two webcams plugged directly into the robotRio , and it made everything super laggy. Any solutions for that?
  4. Any advice for transitioning from TimeBased to Command would be great. Also just anything about PathPlanner, I have no idea what I’m doing and any help would be greatly appreciated as well.

Sorry this was so long and random, I just figured I would post it all in one place. There is no sample code to link. Thank you!

veruca_salt2.0:

What are the advantages of using a RaspberryPi on the robot?

Mini computer is required for vision processing. If you want to make localization or object detection you have to use it. Alternatively you can buy limelight for making this tasks easily.

veruca_salt2.0:

At our last comp we had two webcams plugged directly into the robotRio , and it made everything super laggy. Any solutions for that?

Try reducing fps and resolution.

veruca_salt2.0:

Any advice for transitioning from TimeBased to Command would be great.

You don’t have to pass, but I think it makes things easier. Especially if you have a complex codebase. If I remember correctly, orbit was using timed based last year. The source code of many teams is open, you can take examples from there. You can adapt the existing code for offseason to command base.

I have never used pathplanner with mecanum drive so I can’t say anything about it.
